Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
CAN: The student may draw a basic outline of one type of habitat, such as a body of water or a land area, but details are minimal and not well represented.
The student might be able to include a single element from each habitat, such as a simple shape representing an animal or plant, but without detail.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to draw and label at least two types of habitats and might not distinguish between land and water habitats. *(student doesn't know different habitat types)*
The student is unlikely to label multiple living things or may randomly label items incorrectly, such as calling a tree a fish. *(confuses plant and animal representation)*
There is no clear demonstration of patterns of diversity between the habitats; they may show the same incorrect plant or animal in each habitat. *(doesn't understand diversity)*

The student does not use details in drawings to represent different plants and animals accurately, like shapes or colors, resulting in generic or incorrect depictions. *(lack of detail or observation skills)*

The student may not organize illustrations to show relationships between habitats and living things, potentially placing unrelated items together with no logical order. *(lack of understanding of relationships)*
